author: A_Brickset_user
title: Castle return!!!!!!
review: Very interesting set. New shining silver helmets, scythe-sword, new skeleton face (but skeleton is white not black!) and, last but not least, first in lego history skeleton-horse (white). Really good!

author: Johan_van_den_Heuvel
title: Castle!!... :)
review:
Found this set in a local toy store today. Just needed to pick it up.
It reminded me a lot of set 6012, which i had as a child. :)
The cost was just 4,95 EURO, 7 USD. The price in the USA will probably be lower, due to lego exchange rates. 

pros:
-two real cool knights
-silver helmets!
-working balista
-real cool white skelleton knight (not black as in the photo)
-a white skelleton horse :)
-nice simple shooting mechanism
-potential army building set

cons:
-not much to build, but that really didnt bother me. 

Conclusions:
Finally new sets of 80s and 90s style knights! Just puts a smile on my face. :)
The new white skelleton knight is realy, realy cool. I would advice this set to anyone who likes the Castle theme. Nice set with 3 cool minifigs for 4,95 EURO!! need i say more?...

author: Deinonychus
title: Upon a pale horse...
review:
Crossbow Attack is the smallest of the new Castle sets. This 54 piece set sells for $6-$7 US and is essentially one siege weapon, three Minifigs, and a horse. So what does this small collection of bricks really have to offer?

The main portion of the set, the wheeled crossbow, is a simple little piece that takes no time at all to assemble. It comes in the basic medieval weapon colors of gray, black, and brown with a little dark blue and gold tossed on to mark it as part of this new King’s forces. A pair if Minifig crossbows are also mounted to the weapon, presumably for the gunners to use when their artillery piece fails. A rubber band firing mechanism is mounted to the rear and is used to hurl the axle and ball projectiles a little over two feet…if you’re lucky. It seems a pretty pointless little toy with very little oomph or play value, but it will certainly look good sitting outside the King’s Castle or in the courtyard.

The main draw of this set is actually the Minifigs. The soldiers in the set are totally different in every aspect, so there’s no repeat-figure syndrome here. In addition to the crossbows on the main weapon, the set has an axe for one of the figures, and they both have nice new silver helmets. The undead skeleton warrior comes with the newly redecoed head and improved arms with horizontal grip. He’s armed with a skeleton army shield and a scythe-blade sword that looks truly wicked. In addition to all this, he comes with a skeletal mount. The undead horse is a single molded piece with no articulation. Articulation that’s hardly missed due to the sheer creepiness of having a horse skeleton LEGO piece. And despite what the “official” LEGO images have shown of the set, the skeleton and horse are indeed white and not black in color.

Adding all these elements up, this is a fairly decent set. There’s really not a lot to it building-wise, and you can’t get anything in this box that you can’t get in other sets, or for a better value. $6-$7 for 54 pieces is pushing it, and you’re much better off shelling out the extra money for one of the slightly larger sets like the Final Joust (7009) or Knight’s Catapult Defense (7091). I can’t even really recommend this set as a troop-builder, but if you’re planning on getting most or all of the new Castle sets, it’s still worth having for completion’s sake.

author: lostcarpark
title: Great little castle set
review:
Although there isn't a lot in this set, it's just about perfect for a cheap introduction to Castle, as well as a part kit and army builder.

The minifigs are the set's biggest attraction. The two footsoldiers are both nice individually, but would look great in a regiment of each. A flaw with some similar sets in the past has been a combination of a footsoldier and an officer (or other figure that you don't need more than a few of), which means that you end up with lots of surplus figures. This set is good because everything is useful when you try to build armies. The set includes an axe and two crossbows (which are part of the catapult). It would be nice if there was a second hand weapon (axe/spear/sword) for army building.

I really like skeleton horseman (which is white, not black as shown in some prerelease pictures). I will miss the floppy arms of the old skeletons, but at the end of the day, if we want a menacing skeleton army, they have to be able to hold their arms out straight. The new arm piece is similar to the old droid arm (and I expect we will see them in forthcoming Star Wars sets), but is completly straight at the elbow, and the hand is a 90 degree angle to the shoulder, making it suitable for holding a sword. The scimitar and shield finish it off nicely. The horse is a single piece, and I especially like the way the legs are mimmicing the legs of a "living" Lego horse. It would have been nice if the neck was articulated, though.

I quite like the catapult/launcher. It is a very simple build, but it's nice to see a completely brick built weapon, with no falling back on spring loaded elements. It also contains quite a lot of useful pieces that won't go to waste if the set is used for army building. 6 dark blue cheesers immediately come to mind. The pair of cartwheels should also come in handy.

All in all, this set offers very good value for money, and I will be picking up a few more of them.

author: kirk0007
title: Magnificent!
review:
With the KK2, I decided that lego would never make a good castle series again.  Boy, was I wrong!  While I was at TRU in Deptford, I found this.

1. What you get:
-One skeletal horse
-One white skeleton
-Two soldiers
-One ballista
-Two ballista missiles
-One axe, one scythe blade, one round shield, two crossbows
2. Skeletal horse
The horse is a single molded element.  It looks very cool, and it's stunning with the rider on it, but I'd like to see  just a little articulation.
3. Skeleton
The undead soldier looks like a classic skellie, but he's different in that his arms are of the sort used with Star Wars battle droids, except with the hands angled 90 degrees so that they can hold things.  Altogether an improvement on the original, floppy, smily-faced skeletons, this guy is sinister as well as poseable and is actually creepy.
4. Soldiers
There are two soldiers in this set, but sadly only weapons for one.  The first soldier (who carries the aforementioned axe) is very nice.  His head is that of a Lego city police officer, like the one with the light-up flashlight in that set, and his armor is refreshingly original.  His cone-shaped helmet is silver, and rivals his armor in its cool factor.  The second soldier has a face that I swear is an exact likeness of Sean Connery as James Bond!  His helmet is also chromed, and I like it better than the first one.  At first, I thought his armor was Viking, but it's actually new. The only problem is his defenselessness.
5. Ballista
Thank god this isn't a Bionicle gun like all the other ones in every other castle set.  This ballista  is fairly simple, and it isn't great, but meh,  neither was the real thing!
6. Ammo
Not much to say here.  It's a technic ball attached to a technic axle.
7. Weapons + Armor
The axe is regular old dark bley, unlike those onyx ones from KK2.  It fits in very well.  The scythe blade is brilliant.  It's totally new, and it's beautiful!  The blade looks like a huge scimitar and has one other feature...the pommel is a clip brick so it can be attached to a pole, thus creating the long-awaited Lego scythe!  The shield is new (at least to me) and also deserves some respect.  Thouch small, the design on it is very cool, and isn't a sticker (thank goodness).  Finally, the two crossbows are actually just part of the ballista, but can be removed and used as desired.

Overall, this is a beautiful, well designed set. 10/10 for me, and I plan to buy everything else in this line!

author: reidak49
title: balista nice
review: good set the cross bow fires but not far it looks like it would miss though but sadly there is no wepon for the archer and the skelliton is white but it looks like it is black and he looks very scary thats why they made the cross bow

author: Blade
title: Ballista Attack!
review:
I have put off reviewing this model due to the number of reviews it already had and some of them are really good leaving me with very little to talk about without repeating everyone. 

Well firstly I want everyone to note that the skeleton and the skeletal horse are white, NOT BLACK. They were all made this way and the picture above was an advertising one we are using. If you are desperate for a black pair see set 7009 to get it cheaply. 

With this set you get 2x Soldiers, A Ballista, 2x Missiles, A new skeleton and A Skeletal Horse. Totalling 3 mini-figs one animal and one cart, not bad for $6.66 AUS.

The Ballista is basically a standard cart, with a small leaver, given tension by a rubber band. Very simple and very effective. The carts wheels are the larger wagon style and have duel crossbows mounted on the front. The Ballista uses many shades but I must say the dark blue pieces are very nice and the gold pyramid on the front is very cool. The missiles are just a six length of Technic rod with a ball on the end. Simple, easily make more if wanted or lost and nice to see LEGO gives you two.

The Kings Kastle II (KK2) guards are very well done as well. You can easily tell which is which but that they are clearly from the same team. The one that pushes the Ballista has a chain mail shirt with blue sleeves, dark grey pants and a silver, circular helmet. His face is quite detailed with stubble and a smirk.

The other is wearing a chain mail shirt, with a blue vest over it, grey sleeves, light grey pants and a silver helmet that flares out at the neck. His face is also quite detailed with slanting eyebrows and a look of disgust. He also has a single sided axe, which is one of my favourite weapons.

The skeleton looks the same at first glance but then you notice this face is allot more detailed than the original and looks very dark and evil. Then you notice something else is different. The arms are no longer connected by ball joints and all loose, but rather on pegs like the legs and on a slight angle for better articulation. The arms are now similar to the droids from Star Wars or the aliens from Mars Mission. He has a small round shield that is brow and silver, with a silver skull and a grey scythe, which looks fantastic. A must have for any armoury. 

The only weak point I can really find with this set is in the skeletal horse. The skeletal horse he rides looks quite creepy and fits in well, but personally I feel he could have had a bit more detail, mainly in the face. At this point it is just one solid piece with no articulation. A face mask or some form of eyes would have really finished this piece of the set off nicely. But hey overall a great idea and a great start.

Overall I feel this is one of the best impulse sets I have seen for a long time and I am sure most kids that love LEGO would have this by now. Excellent Aesthetics, great colours new pieces and revamped pieces are just some of the reasons why this is a great set. Personally I feel this set is an 8/10 or Excellent. If you don’t already own this model I would seriously recommend it.

author: benners30
title: army buidler
review:
this is definetly an army builder. it has a dark skellie, 2 knights, a ballista, 2 ballista missles and a living dead horse. 

it also has tons of accesories such as , 2 crossbows, ax, and scythe blade.

great set

author: Nased
title: Smallest but Fantastic set of the Castle Series
review:
There are two problems with the picture. The skeleton should be white and the skeleton horse should be white too(instead of black). 

Putting that aside, this is the smallest(as of October 2007) set in the new Castle series. It cost me only $9.00SGD to to own this set. The price is good as I get 1 skeleton rider with the awesome scythe. the keleton rider has a small round skeleton shield too. The skeleton looks evil and it really represents the evil force. 

On the other side, there are two crown knights in this set. An archer and a warrior. The warrior is an axe man. He has one axe while the acher is in charge of firing the ballistic, the archer could take either of the crossbows mounted on the push cart should he wish to.

I like this set because I get 3 mini figures at a cheap price. the only thing that I would love to see is to give some shields and another melee weapon to the archer. That's just my personal preference. I prefer my knights to have at least one melee weappon and a shield each.

It's great, just get it to complete the entire series. I will still give it a 5/5 even though I would love to see improvements to the sets coming out in 2008.

author: GreatBear
title: Solid Value
review:
A great set. The figures are all fun and the mini ballista shoots well and is quite "playable".

The set is great value too, especially when compared to the latest 5 packs of Knights 852271 or Skeletons 852272 ($13 US and $18 each in Canada!?). Buy 2 of these for less cash and get more figures. 

NOTE: The set does not include a black skeleton & horse as shown in the photo - at least in Canada - the skeleton horse and rider are white.

author: skyscraper
title: Definetly worth 5 $
review:
This is a great army builder buy two of theese and you have a partial army. Its great buy two for 10$ Crossbow shoots farther than you think it would. I also looks great and the knights looks super good. Cheap and great playability . 

Pros

-cross bow shoots perfectly 
-skeletal horse
-skelaton

- good helemts

Cons

author: Loganwan
title: A good set
review:
This set is very nice.  You get three minifigs, the two soldiers have different faces.  The skeleton looks menacing and dangerous.  You get a giant sword and shield for the skeleton, and a battle axe.  On the crossbow there are two hand-held crossbows.  Everyone is saying that only one soldier gets a weapon, but I think that the other solder gets to shoot the large crossbow as well as having the two smaller crossbows.  Now that looks to me like that is plenty of firepower to me.  I cannot understand all of the complaints.

Granted, the catapult does not fire the bolt a great distance, but for the scale, it is plenty.  It is not supposed to be a massive machine.

author: BlackRabbit
title: great value
review:
this is a very useful castle set .you can use the balista on your castle walls on just have it sit in the armory.and with 2 knights you can easily fill your castle barracks.although one of them is unarmed you can still take one of the crossbows off the seige weapon the crossbow fires perrfectlyand can go very far. i dont care much for the skeloton horse but it works at least the skeloton itself is good.

pros 

good colour
awsome knights
good catapult
good skeloton

cons

one knight is unarmed
i dont like the skeloton horse

author: greenfrog_7
title: Crossbow... Attack!
review: This is a great set for it's size and price, and I appreciate the little things that work the way they are intended - it's nice that I can actually fire the bolts a decent distance and knock over the skeleton knights. I assume that the time I spent on target practice was not unique, and look forward to more sets like this with good playability at a low price point.

author: hustla187
title: Just a Modernly Normal Set
review: This set isn't good nor bad. The cannon sort of looks cool but may not work. I hate the skeleton horse which is stupid and Lego is trying to go emo on its sets. Let's hope that Lego stops making the emo castle sets.

author: bionicle101
title: good, cheap army-builder
review:
This is the smallest 2007 Castle set, but it's a good price and should be included in every lego Castle army. Well, on to the pros and cons.

Pros:

Cool skeleton.

Shooting function works well

A quick build

Good amount of "Playability"

Good weapons

Neat horse


Cons:

Zzzzipppo! this is a 100/100 set! 2 thumbs up!

author: Obi_Wan9994
title: Attack!
review:
This is my first set in the Castle series. 

Pros:
2 different knights with different armor, one has a battle axe.
white skeleton(the photo above is wrong)- new evil face, and different arms from the old one. comes with a neat sword and shield.
White Undead Horse(the photo above is wrong again)- brings your skeleton into battle, looks cool.
Crossbow, fires one missle at a time(but you get 2), all you do is pull it back and the rubberband causes it to  fire. It has a pair of wheels, so it just rolls right into battle. The crossbow is made out of lots of nice pieces,and it's real sturdy.
Great army builders
Really low price
Small, easy to transport

Cons: 
A place to hold the the missles on the crossbow would have been nice.

author: andy87
title: Great army builder
review:
Very nice set, but the skeliton is white not black and it has 3 awesome minifigs!

Pros: Very cheap
      3 mimifigs
      2 crossbows
Cons: Cannon doesn't fire well
 Its still a pretty good set

author: rabk295
title: So so
review: I got this set for my birthday, and it's not that great. The mini figs are cool, and the horse is awesome, but the cannon doesn't even work. Overall, it's not worth the money. I don't think you should waste your money on it when you could save it for something better.

author: spyder38
title: Hope they make more!
review: This set is just downright awesome! for $5, it's a great deal. Just think about it, 3 minifigs! The price is true to the amount of legos. This is my first lego Castle set, and this little set just got me hooked on castle. The picture on the top of the page is wrong, it's actually a white skeleton and horse. The skeleton is able to pose his legs and arms- a huge plus from the old skeletons lego had. The skeleton horse is all one piece, and looks so cool. It includes 2 knights, each with different silver helmets. You get 2 missiles with it, although it can only fire 1 at a time. I'm looking at it right now as I write this review. Some of my favorite pieces are the navy cheesers, (those little slopes) 2 silver crossbows, wagon wheels, new skeleton face, and the gold piece. Yes that's right, a $5 lego set comes with a nice gold piece, not to mention those 2 silver crossbows again. Many people have said that one knight does not come with a weapon.(the other one has an axe) And then they continue to say that he doesn't have a weapon because he man's the big crossbow. That is what I say too, but if you are that mad about it, just take the 2 silver crossbows off the front and have him dual-wield them. THIS SET COMES WITH EVERYTHING FOR A CHEAP LOW PRICE, AND IS A GREAT ARMY BUILDER. BUY IT. PERIOD.

author: allencao3
title: Good army builder but…
review:
I personally like 7091 better than this but it does have some unique selling points including
- The only small set that comes with an archer torso and helmet. I actually want a bigger number of ranged soldiers.
- Cheapest way to get a skeleton rider. A white one unlike what is shown on the picture but it works well for me anyway.

The reason why I mentioned 7091 is better than this set is because the namesake part, the ballista, is not well-designed as the catapult. The elastic band thing is a nice try but it doesn’t look good. Why are there 2 crossbows on the sides? Are they supposed to fire automatically? It just doesn’t make any sense to me. The ballista could have been better made IMO.

Enough of the complaints, I am not expecting too much from a set like this but enough minifigs to represent the value and it works out fine. A 7/10.

review:
i will do pros and cons.

     this is an awesome set. its one of the few 2007 castle sets still avable.

author: the_lead_general
title: Army builder
review:
Crossbow attack.
 
Plus+
     Great number of figures and they are only $1.50 each if the catapult is $2. The skeleton horseman is great. The crossbow-man has a very nice rare helmet and face. the catapult is well sized and is about as big as a cannon scaled to Lego size. I was not in favour of the skeleton horse when they came out but it is now part of the castle family and look much better than a normal one. It also has great compatibility as i will explain later.

Minus-
      The catapult must be modified by raising the elastic band to the notch in the grey trigger or bit in order to achieve better than 15 cm or 6 inches. When modified it shoots a large distance up to 60cm, 24 inches. Also the skeleton does not have a helmet and is white not black in Australia but that is excusable. 

Equals=
       A great small set, well priced, good number of men, nice siege weapon, and great playability.

Compatibility
             Two of this set goes well with a Final Joust for a beginner, 4 with a Kings castle siege makes a great set an one with Tower raid adds to the playability. Any more than two and you have a small army as I have 8 with almost fifty soldiers.

author: Qu
title: Please ignore my first post on this set.
review:
INTRODUCTION
First of all, I didn't realize how much my first post concentrated on the unimportant aspects of the set. Let me start again.

MINIFIGS
This set with three, two crown soldiers and a skeleton. For the soldiers there is an archer and a combat soldier. The Archer is smiling and unarmed and the combat soldier caries a gray battle axe but no shield. The skeleton has red eyes and is white, along with his horse. He caries a scythe blade and a round shield with a skull on it.

ACCESSORIES
The skeleton is fully armed but the only weapon between the crown soldiers is a gray battle axe. Until I receive a shipment of bows from Ebay, I gave the archer an extra sword.

THE BALLISTA
The ballista is compact and very playable. It comes with two blunt-tipped bolts (not spears, they could hurt your eyes). The two crossbows and gold piece on the front of the cart really complete the set. Some parts could use stability and there should be some storage for the second. There is also a part at the back that allows a minifig to push it.

WHAT IT COULD USE
The archer needs a bow and the combat soldier needs a shield. There also needs to be a crate for the crossbow bolts.

PROS AND CONS
  • Pros
  • Three minifigs
  • Siege engine
  • Very playable set
  • Good selection for the few accessories
  • Nice look to the set

  • Cons
  • Some parts on cart unstable
  • Needs more accessories
I really recommend this set.
Thank you,
Qu.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Castle (Fantasy Era) - Crossbow Attack
review:
The Crossbow Cart set (7090) is a LEGO Castle (Fantasy Era) set which came out in 2007. It comes with 3 minifigs and 54 pieces. This set does include no decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/7090-1.jpg[/img]

Minifigures:

Knight 1: The knight has a very cool metal helmet and a basic LEGO City face. There's nothing special about that minifig.

Knight 2: The other knight does look more serious and he comes with a different armor and a different helmet. He also has an axe.

Skeleton: The skeleton does look very cool. He has the evil look and the red eyes. He comes with a nice looking scythe and a shield which has a skull on it. He also comes with a horse. He also has a skeleton horse but the legs and the head don't move.

Crossbow Cart:

The crossbow cart is very easy to build. It has two wheels on each side and a handle where the knights can hold it. You can also see a rubber band and a lever which shoots the missiles. On the front you can also see a crossbow on each side.

Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Nice starter set
Great army builder
No stickers

Negative:

Not so many play features
Too easy to build

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1
Stopmotion 2
Review

author: bogdanst
title: Greatest army builder ever
review:
This set is just great - no parts that a true castle collector cannot use. The "crossbow" works great, 2 knights are for army building, and the skeleton in my set was white (both the fig and the horse) which is better than black IMHO.

Only thing I could ask for is another shield for the knights.

I bought several, and if I could find them again, I would buy more because the price/army ratio is just great.

author: AETerry
title: Crossbow Attack Review
review: At $9.99, this wasn't a bad set to pick up. You got a good siege/battle field weapon with the crowbow launcher, 2 Castle Minifigures and a Black Skeleton on a Black Skeleton horse. Making it a good army builder. The main draw for me were all the new elements and accessories for army building. Nothing too outstanding, especially if you've been building and collecting a lot of Castle over the years. For those younger, this is a still a solid set and well worth picking up.
